body.p:
Head-Quarters Military Commander, Lousiville.
Louisville, Ky., Dec. 1st 1863.
His Excellency Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of Ky
Govenor.

I would respectfully recommend to You the bearer J. K. Edwards who has been acting under me as U. S Detective for some months and whose Courage and efficiency I can endorse. By direction of Genl. Boyle I send him to report to you for special duty and I will say to you that you can rely on him. Edwards will relate his private history since the war Commenced to you and I know you will him the best in your power. He is desirous of holding an honorary Commission. Can't you appoint him a staff officer?

Respectfully
M Mundy
Col & Mil Com L.
